We have to come to terms with the fact that we don't always have all of the information we'd like to have, but we have to go on making sensible decisions each and every day.

Now we have to be able to differentiate between the real risks and the hypothetical ones, and I don't think we're always doing a good job in this country about doing it.

There are real things that we can focus on--quitting smoking, wearing helmets--helmets even made of plastics--and doing things like wearing seat belts and exercising, things that we can do to improve our health.
